benchmark_details.name: Crowd RAG Corpus 2025 (CrowdRAG-25)
benchmark_details.overview: The Crowd RAG Corpus 2025 consists of 903 human-written and 903 LLM-generated responses for 301 topics, including utility judgments across various dimensions, aimed at evaluating retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate the efficacy of crowdsourcing for evaluation in retrieval-augmented generation scenarios, analyzing response writing and judgement.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The study uses a specific set of topics from TREC RAG'24 which may limit generalizability.

data.source: Crowdsourced human workers and LLM (OpenAI's GPT-4 model) for generating and judging RAG responses.
data.annotation: Responses written by crowdsourced workers and evaluated by both human and LLM judgments.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated using pairwise comparisons for assessing response quality.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better responses according to utility dimensions such as coherence and coverage.
methodology.validation: Validated through expert judgments and inter-rater reliability measures.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Informed consent was obtained from participants and measures were taken for data anonymization.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution International 4.0 License.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants were provided with information and consent forms before participation.
